Name: Kampala
Description: Kampala, the City of Seven Hills, is the capital city of Uganda and is, by a very large margin, the largest city in the country. Secondary to it is Jinja to the east and Entebbe to the south. Kampala is in the south central part of Uganda, near the northern shores of Lake Victoria.

Name: Arua
Description: Arua is a city in Northwestern Uganda.

Name: Entebbe
Description: Entebbe is a pleasant town built on the shores of Lake Victoria in Uganda.

Name: Jinja
Description: Jinja is a city in Uganda.

Name: Fort Portal
Description: Fort Portal is an important town and centre of the Kabarole District in Western Uganda.

Name: Gulu
Description: Gulu is an important city of Northern Uganda. It's the economic centre of the region, has some useful facilities for travellers and a handful of historic attractions. As violence related to the LRA rebel groups diminished, more NGO workers and travellers settled in and generally friendly local business owners are finding ways to cater to the increasing demand for hotels and restaurants. All in all, this may not yet be a vibrant city nor the most beautiful of Uganda destinations, but it has a charm of its own and breathes the energy of a community shaking off its past.

Name: Mbarara
Description: Mbarara is a city in Western Uganda.

Name: Kabale
Description: Kabale is a small city in Western Uganda near Lake Bunyonyi.

Name: Kisoro
Description: The township of Kisoro only has about 18,000 inhabitants living in the town proper, but there are more than a quarter of a million in its district, mostly eking out a living as subsistence farmers on low incomes. It's the last sizeable settlement in Western Uganda, hard up against the borders of both the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda.

Name: Ajai Game Reserve
Description: Ajai Game Reserve is in Northern Uganda.

Name: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park
Description: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park is in Western Uganda. The park is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Name: Mgahinga Gorilla National Park
Description: Mgahinga Gorilla National Park is in Western Uganda and the nearest town is Kisoro.

Name: Kidepo Valley National Park
Description: Kidepo Valley National Park is in northeast Uganda. It covers 1436  km² and borders onto South Sudan.

Name: Murchison Falls National Park
Description: Murchison Falls National Park is in Northern Uganda. The park covers approximately 3840 km², and the River Nile passes through. Rabonga Forest in the southeast has large populations of chimps and the Nile has a lot of hippopotamuses and crocodiles.

Name: Queen Elizabeth National Park
Description: Queen Elizabeth National Park is in Western Uganda. The park covers an area of over 774 sq miles between Lake Edward and Lake George, around the Kasinge Channel connecting the two.

Name: Kibale Forest National Park
Description: Kibale Forest National Park is situated in Western Uganda, near the town of Fort Portal, and is famed for its chimpanzees.

Name: Rwenzori National Park
Description: Rwenzori National Park is in Western Uganda.

Name: Ssese Islands
Description: The Ssese Islands are an archipelago of 84 islands in the northwest of Lake Victoria, Uganda. About 43 of the islands are inhabited. The islands vary in size from less than 10,000 m², to over 40 km long for the largest island, Buggala.

Name: Lake Bunyonyi
Description: Lake Bunyonyi is a charming lake dotted with little islands in Western Uganda. The terraced landscape and vibrant colours make it almost cartoonish.
